title: I'm a little conflicted on the changes this patch

embed.description: Greetings, Summoners. Welcome to patch 5.13, the super mega large one that has a lot of AP item changes and the new Devourer enchantment. Now, you might be thinking, "Huh, that's a very functional title and not at all very sleek," but we're here to communicate, not sell.

body:
I'm a little conflicted on how I feel this patch, because there are a few huge changes coming, and I'm not sure how I can adapt with my main and my playstyle.

I've mained Singed since late season 3. That season I rose up to gold for the first time, and I've loved playing SInged ever since. I usually run a tear into rylai's build, and enjoy staying just out of reach from my enemy, and baiting them into trying to kill me. This patch changes the items that I usually run on him, and affects the core mechanics, that make my playstyle possible.

Let's talk about the slow stacking change first: "Slows no longer stack. Instead, in the case of overlapping slows, the strongest slow takes precedent and all other slows have no effect." This means now when I W and slow with my poison trail I will lose out on the slow I would have pre-patch (Keep in mind my build with rylai's). As well if I had flipped my opponent, (losing the stack slow with e+q), and therefore will make it harder for me to duel my opponents, because they will simply less slow than before. Making trading more punishing due to their ability to trade back.

This already makes my playstyle on Singed harder, which is bad, but they also changed Rylai's, making it impossible. I'm talking about the change to Rylai's build path. Where they removed blasting rod in the favor of Needlessly Large Rod. Not only is it more expensive to fully build, delaying Singed's power spike, but also makes it harder to do damage early game, due to the high build costs. This hurts Singed's early game, very hard.

The only solace is the changes to Rod of Ages. This is because the item is now more viable on Singed than ever, due to the increased mana and AP stats and how quickly you can afford it. And even though RoA is a popular build on SInged, I never enjoyed using it as much as Rylai's because I enjoy the slow I get against auto-attack reliant champions.

Needless to say I will need to adapt my build, but I still get a bit sad knowing that I will never be able to play Singed the way I want to, at least to the same effect, as I could before. I suppose this is change, and change is good, but I'll miss the patches before this and I was wondering if there are any other champions that are getting gimped due to the changes this patch. I would appreciate your thought in the comments below, and I was hoping we could spark some discussion here, seeing this is a pretty big patch, on how changes are concerned.

Your whole point regarding the stacking of rylai slow with mega adhesive slow is pretty much a moot point. This is because of the minimum movement speed caps, realistic enemy champion move speeds, the already weak slow stacking mechanic, and the addition of a scaling to the snare duration on E+W.

So, let's assume an enemy champion has a base move speed of 350 (that's high), tier 2 boots, and has a 10% movespeed buff from... something. That would put their raw movespeed at 434.5. On patch 5.12, a level 1 singed W combined with an AoE slow from Rylai (Q) would modify that by (.65)x(1-[.35x.35]), as slows only actually stacked at 35% effectiveness for any slow past the first, regardless of what Riot said in the notes. This would result in a move speed of 247. On patch 5.13, a level 1 Singed W would not combine with the Rylai slow at all, so the 434.5 move speed would only be modified by .65, resulting in 282 move speed. Note that no soft caps would apply in either case. An enemy would require approximately .08 seconds less to cross your Mega Adhesive on patch 5.13 than they would on patch 5.12, but this time would be negated after approximately 1.4 seconds of chasing you after leaving the Mega Adhesive. Note that this difference only exists if you have a Rylai's, your W is not yet maxed, and your opponent has a reasonably high move speed. Lower enemy move speeds, greater points in W, or a lack of Rylai's reduce or remove this difference entirely.

If we take a look at the 15% slow plus the 35% Mega Adhesive slow on patch 5.12 vs patch 5.13, the difference is appreciably less. Again, 434.5x(.65)x(1-[.35x.15]) would result in a final move speed of 268, with the same move speed of 282 on patch 5.13. This difference would be relevant for the time it took the enemy to get off of the Mega Adhesive, a maximum of 175 units if they run across the whole thing. That means  that the time your opponent saves running across your Mega Adhesive on patch 5.13 vs 5.12 is .03 seconds. This would be negated by the 5% stronger Rylai slow on patch 5.13 after less than .75 seconds of chasing you after getting off the Mega Adhesive.

If we assume a higher level in your W, things get even better for patch 5.13. With a max rank W, an E+W will result in a snare for the full 2 seconds of the duration of a 35% slow on patch 5.12, meaning that we don't have to adjust for that at all. Instead, it will take an enemy a full 1 second *longer* to cross your Mega Adhesive if you Fling them onto it on patch 5.13 than on patch 5.12. 

If we assume you aren't Flinging them onto it, then we'll compare a (.25)x(1-[.15x.35]) modifier on patch 5.12 to a (.25) modifier on patch 5.13. These result in raw move speeds of  103 and 109, respectively. However, there is a raw move speed of cap when move speed falls below 220. The modifier to these raw speeds is (raw speedx.5)+110, resulting in final move speeds of 162 and 164, for patch 5.12 and patch 5.13 respectively. Therefore, on patch 5.12, enemies slows by Rylai Q and your maxed Mega Adhesive will cross your Mega Adhesive .02 seconds faster on patch 5.13 than on patch 5.12. This would be negated by the 5% stronger Rylai slow on patch 5.13 after chasing your for approximately .5 seconds after getting off the Mega Adhesive.

The only time this isn't true is if the enemy is exceptionally fast- something like a Rammus or Quinn. In either case, you're going to get caught no matter how slows stack.

TL;DR:
Singed's ability to kite is stronger on patch 5.13 than it is on patch 5.12 under almost all circumstances.

You seem to misunderstand how tenacity and slow stacking work, both currently and historically.

Prior to patch 5.13, slows stack 35% effectiveness. That is, the strongest slow is fully applied, and any further slows are only 35% effective. Note that only 1 item can slow a champion at a time. So if you add a hextech gunblade slow to a rylai slow, they never stacked together at all.

Tenacity has always stacked multiplicatively. Otherwise, there would have been several ways to get over 100% tenacity:

Irelia passive (40%) + Tenacious (pre-5.12, 15%) + merc treads (35%) + elixir of iron (25%) = 115%

Irelia passive (40%)+ Cleanse tenacity (65% for 3 secs after use)=105%

Mundo W (40%)+... above^

How it actually works has always been:

Irelia Passive (40%) + Tenacious (15%) + merc treads (35%) + elixir of iron (25%) = 1-(.6x.85x.65x.75)=75.2% tenacity

Irelia passive (40%)+ Cleanse tenacity (65% for 3 secs after use)= 1-(.6*.35)=79% tenacity

ect, ect

However, there was briefly a glitch where Elixir of Iron in particular would stack additively with other tenacity- meaning all other tenacity till stacked multiplicatively, but the iron pot would add a flat 25% tenacity on top. So you could, actually, reach:

Irelia passive (40%) + tenacious (15%) + merc treads (35%) + cleanse tenacity (65%) + elixir of iron (25%)= 1-(.6*.85*.65*.35)+.25=113.4% tenacity

For obvious reasons, Rito fixed this....

Many of the Singed mains in higher ELO  tend to call RoA a "newbie trap"  ... Not me, but they do.
